body:
That's an interesting example, and I'll confess it's not one I considered, but you can avoid it just as easily by creating a separate accessor for display purposes, e.g.

```ruby
    def announcement_html
      self.announcement.html_safe
    end
```

This has the added benefit of being more obvious to someone new reading your code.

The other downside to this fix is that it wouldn't fix your code should you use

```ruby
  form.text_area :announcement
```

Which arguably makes more sense.

Anyway, it's probably best to still sanitize that html rather than trusting it completely, but that's up to you as I've no idea what your app does :)
